Reviews.Title: Review by actual owner - great little snapshot camera
Reviews.Author: Davey Williams "davey williams"
Reviews.Content: I was able to get this model a little early, and was excited to try it out in - what better city to test a camera? - Paris. The last Sony snapshot camera I used was on a trip in 2007, and I was so dissatisfied with that camera that I sold it immediately after returning home. I was eager to see if Sony had improved their entry level cameras, especially the picture quality. I shall post some pictures to offer examples up in the product details, but these will be reduced in size for posting.Photo quality: My initial day out indicated that they have made dramatic improvements in both quality and speed. Photos in daylight were crisp and clear in just about every shot, and any that weren't were only because I was shooting poorly on purpose to test the photos. I was also quite happy with the quality of shots in low light and indoors, which is where I noticed the most improvement over past Sony low-end offerings. There was some blurring in darker situations, of course, but for the most part the software was able to produce images that are well balanced and low grain. The 14 megapixel feature is great - there are many photos I've been able to crop and retain quality, and photos of, say, a stone sarcophagus can be zoomed in upon when viewing images later to see very good detail.I must also mention that the camera is very good at balancing photos. It almost always produces a picture with an appropriate contrast, and only in the worst cases did the image wash out in an area. For example, a shot of Joan of Arc (the statue, not the person) in Notre Dame came out very well even with a stained glass window in the background. The stained glass was bright but distinguishable, and the detail of the stone statue was clear and well balanced. Only in extreme cases - such as a shot of a black sculpture in the Louvre with a window behind it with blaring sunlight - did the camera fail to balance the image, but these are the kind of bad photography shots one would never expect a camera to take well.Types of Photos: Like most all snapshot photos, this camera will perform best shooting still subjects with plenty of light. Moving objects didn't tend to blur, a problem I'd had with other cheap snapshot cameras, but the response time can make getting these shots difficult. Trying to capture a motorcycle passing an old church, my 7-10 attempts were mostly good photos, but getting the moving bike in the exact spot I wanted was nearly impossible.Features: Overall, this camera lacks in features, although for most uses I found it sufficient, and at the price I didn't expect a lot of extras. The 4x zoom is relatively fast and easy to use, and about right for this type of camera. I was surprised there was no optical zoom given the high megapixels, but I can live with cropping on the computer. The panorama mode is nifty but not that useful - it works quite well in creating a long image, which of course will cause distortion in most cases. To use this feature, you set the mode and clich the shutter. The camera will prompt you to move it from left to right, and then it will generate the image (which is always impossible to see on the display owing to its shape.) Here I would have liked some add'l features - there is just 'one size' for panorama shots - you must sweep all the way across or the image will fail. This creates many shots that will need to be messed with on the computer later, which is okay but annoying. I was also disappointed panorama doesn't work in an up and down orientation - you always have to sweep the camera in the same manner. You can, of course, hold it sideways to create a vertical panorama, but I really wanted some vertical shots tqking advantage of a larger width. Still, panoramas of the Tour Eiffel allowed me to create some fun, unique shots of the full height of the structure. There are not many other features - just some rudimentary quality settings, face detection, etc. Some might want to move up to a camera with more features, but I actually appreciated this in a point and shoot camera.Battery life: Here the camera could use some help. Perhaps I'm spoiled by my Apple products, but digital cameras have more or less remained stuck in 2002 concerning batteries. It's annoying to have a separate charger, and battery life isn't great. Three hours of shooting...granted, constant shooting...at St Denis drained it. Given how light and small it is, I'd fully support doubling the battery size to get twice the life. I'd also love for camera makers to start to move toward USB charging options.I'd also love it if cameras would start incorporating some onboard space. It feels like the dark ages to have to buy a card. 2 - 4 gig of onboard memory with a card slot for expansion would be nice.Overall, a great, small, fun camera that's easy to grab and go. I wish Sony would re-imagine some of the ways digital cameras work, perhaps taking some cues from iPods, especially regarding batteries, but for the price this nifty unit is great.Pros: Excellent pics for camera in this price range, good color balance, good in darker spaces, a few fun featuresCons: Battery life could be better, charging options, not many features or in-camera editing options

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: The intelligent shooting mode is great--it detects different scene types (landscape, sunny, cloudy, etc.) and auto-adjusts the exposure settings to get the best picture. Picture quality is great. It also has a movie mode that takes nice videos. The mic for the audio is a little weak but it is only a point and shoot camera, so a so-so mic is to be expected. The panorama mode is very easy to use--just point and sweep while holding the shutter--and the camera automatically stitches everything together with no overlap or missed sections. I've used panorama mode at a baseball stadium and at a lake and got great detail in both settings.The battery life could be a bit better, but it lasts for at least 8 hours of shooting. I was turning the camera off and on a lot, which had a bigger drain on the battery, I'm sure.I first used a SanDisk 4GB Memory Stick Pro Duo with this camera, and the camera would not read the card properly. I even reformatted the memory card with my computer and the camera still would not read the card. I finally purchased a SanDisk SDHC memory card that works fine. Others have had problems too with the SanDisk Memory Stick Pro Duo, so be careful with that.Pros- Intelligent mode for automatically adjusting the settings; picture quality; movie mode and panorama mode; good quality for the price.Cons- Rechargeable battery could last a bit longer; Battery is specific Sony battery that can only be charged from a wall outlet with the included charging doc; Mic is a bit weak for audio when shooting movies.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures but horribly slow
Reviews.Author: L. Ambrose
Reviews.Content: I've purchased Canon cameras exclusively for the past 15 years. This was my first foray into other brands, and while the photo quality (particularly in low light situations) is fantastic, this camera has made me regret my decision to do so. For a point-and-shoot it fundamentally fails the "point and SHOOT" test because of the frustratingly slow focus time. The camera simply will not take a picture quickly. I can't tell you how many great shots I've lost because of this feature. I've read the manual, played with the options and experimented with different ways of taking shots ("focusing" early by depressing the shutter button, just hitting it once...everything!) and nothing seems to work. (I'm open to suggestions if others have noticed this)To be perfectly fair, the quality of the pictures is really great. I just wish there was a way to make it faster and, therefore, more usable. If you don't have kids and pets, it's a great camera. However, uncooperative fast-moving subjects make for very tough photo opps.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera.
Reviews.Author: Linda R "Linda R"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera.  It does exactly what it says it's going to do.  First charge on the battery took over 125pictures without needing a charge.  I only charged it because I didn't want it to die in the middle of me using it next time.  Pictures look great in outdoor and indoor pictures. Best point and shoot I have owned.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!!
Reviews.Author: StacyLee
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera! Only had it for a week, but this is the best part so far: I am not a photographer and not super tech-savvy, but I opened the box, put in the battery and extra storage thingy and turned the camera on and started taking pictures. I still have not looked at the directions and have been taking pictures and downloading them to my computer for a week.......the photos look really great to me. If you are looking for a camera for dummies that takes nice pics and is low priced, this is the one!!!!

Reviews.Title: Sony = Lemons and Lies
Reviews.Author: DenVilda "one4time"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera from Walmart on June 3rd 2011 for a trip I was planning to Arizona. (I live in North Carolina). The first pictures I took with the camera were really great and couldn't wait to take pictures of the wide open mountains ranges in southern Arizona. However, on the third day of my trip I noticed the LCD began to look warped. Since this was my first digital camera I'm not sure what was wrong. I continued to take pictures in Arizona just hoping there was a slight glitch with the LCD display and it would not affect the picture quality.When I got home a few weeks later I uploaded all the pictures to my computer and to my horror noticed that they all came out poorly. Many of the pictures looked as if extra light was burned into the pixels and many of the pixels would softly bleed into each other. Hey, it looks great if you're trying to create a dream-like ethereal effect but that is hardly what I was looking for. Since I was quite upset I returned to Walmart and told that I would need to contact Sony. I did so. The Sony representative told me that I would need to mail the camera to their support facility in Laredo, Texas. I did so and paid about $5.00 to have it shipped. During my first contact with Sony I was told that the camera would be fixed since it was still under warranty. However, the story didn't last too long. I was then told that the warranty would not cover the 'damage' to the camera and that I would need to pay $37.00 for the repair. Then I contacted Sony again and was told that the camera would not be fixed and that they were just going to send it back to me. When I inquired about the reason for this I was told that 'moisture' was in the camera. I mentioned that I noticed the LCD screen would often fog up all time -- after all I live in the South and gets quite humid during the summer months. The tech then told me that 'ambient moisture' from a humid environment was not covered by the warranty. So in other words, if I use this camera on a humid southern day it make distort the pixels and Sony will not fix it.When I received my camera back from Sony not only had they not fixed the camera -- no surprise -- but they didn't even return my memory card. So the few pictures that did turn out well are now lost because Sony lost -- stole, misplaced, etc -- my memory card. So basically I just paid $5.00 and all I got in return from Sony was a lost memory card.Outraged, I went by Walmart to explain the situation to them and they actually were very understanding and kind and made an ad hoc decision to honor a return, even though it was outside their fifteen day return policy. However, I will never purchase another Sony product. Sony sells cheap cameras that cannot even withstand the humid weather in the south, and if your camera 'breaks' while the warranty is in effect they will still refuse to honor the warranty! The warranty I purchased through Walmart was even worse. I contacted the company that Walmart outsources to for warranties and was also told that they would not honor the warranty and that if I wanted it fixed I should try to take it to Radio Shack! So I guess the morale of this story is that warranties are useless and Sony sells lemons. Take heed.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Adam Graham
Reviews.Content: Really just as expected. Quality hardware from Sony as always, quality images a camera at this size and price. Takes not only Sony MemoryStick but also standard SD cards as well. It's light, so it's not a burden to carry in a pocket or purse, but not so light that it feels hollow and chincy. The settings allow for very simple point-and-shoot operation as well as some more moderately advanced settings for different scenes and lighting. Intuitive interface. All-around good buy.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Becky
Reviews.Content: My family and I were going on a cruise in a limo for my grandparents' 50th anniversery. It was my first time in a limo let alone on a cruise and I was very excited! My sister had a digital camera and of course, I wanted one too. Not only for the vacation, but for other special memories too. So I was looking online and there it was! I knew it was the perfect one for me! It was PINK, it was a high yet affordable price, and it could hold many pictures without having to upload them. I came back and I had so much fun! My camera was loaded with pictures! I am never going to forget that cruise! This camera is very fast and extremely thin. I don't even know if it is in my hand half the time! I would recommend this to not only a friend but every friend and stranger I see. So get this camera and see for yourself how great it really is!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Colin Christopher
Reviews.Content: I haven't bought a new camera for myself in years, so I did a lot of research before buying this one. Actually, I did too much research and wound up confused. I finally just broke down and ordered this one because it seemed like a good deal.I'm really glad I bought it. It takes great pictures and it's easy to use. I don't like to spend a lot of time figuring out technology, and the menu on this camera makes things really easy to figure out. I haven't even looked at the owner's manual since I got the camera. The panoramic feature is awesome: just set it on panoramic, hold the button down, and scan the scene from left to right.The only thing I wish this camera had was a lower MP setting. It takes pictures in four settings: VGA, 5 MP, 10 MP, and 14 MP. The 10 and 14 are very detailed and ideal for blowing up into large prints. Even the 5 MP looks good in a large size. The VGA setting is pretty poor quality, not even worthy of viewing on your computer or sending to someone via email. The solution to this is the 5 MP setting, which produces a great quality picture but is also a very large-sized file, so you can't send many pics at once. It would be great if this camera had a 2 or 3 MP setting. Not a huge deal, though.UPDATE 3/31/13: This camera still works great. The battery still holds a charge just fine (knock on wood.) I have no regrets about this purchase.

Reviews.Title: It's OK
Reviews.Author: JMiller
Reviews.Content: I needed a point and shoot camera and as my last camera was a Sony, I didn't really question the quality.  The difference between a 14 vs a 10 megapixel is very noticeable and I love the panoramic mode.  I'm just a little disappointed with the shutter delay.  There is a mode in which you can take back to back picture but you can't be picky with the second frame.....whatever and whereever the camera gets, you get.  The pics without the flash or when flash is off seem to come out better than when the flash is on (or when set to automatic).  I've only had this camera for a couple of weeks and have not yet played with the menu to get the best set up....perhaps somewhere in the menu is an adjustment for the shutter delay.  It literrally takes 2-3 seconds before you can take the next shot.

Reviews.Title: Great choice!
Reviews.Author: M. Zito
Reviews.Content: Was shopping for a reliable point & shoot digital camera & this was recommended to me by a friend. After researching & reading reviews, I decided on this one & am glad I did.

Reviews.Title: Great While It Lasted....
Reviews.Author: shayes
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera before I went on a trip to the Bahamas. Took great pictures, loved the quality. Then after maybe one month the camera started screwing up. It would start erratically switching between programs (from Auto to panoramic, etc.) while I was trying to just take a photo. I sent it to Sony, and surprise--they didn't find anything wrong with it. They just reset the camera, which did absolutely nothing. As soon as I tried to take another photograph, it did the same exact thing. The new problem it has had is not recognizing my memory card! Frustrating piece of junk, wish I hadn't bought it in the first place.

Reviews.Title: I want to like this camera.
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Lexus
Reviews.Content: This camera takes beautiful pictures when it's a sunny  day. That is, if you're willing to wait for the shutter delay. It hesitates and sometimes doesn't even capture the picture. If it's dark out or you're indoors, then forget it. You'll get a bunch of blurry pictures and squiggly lines. If you do manage to take a decent picture, you'll be disappointed when you load it onto your computer. Many of my pictures comes out very soft and washed out. The battery slide cover is also in a awkward position. I find that I'll sometimes open the battery cover when I take pictures. I would steer clear of this camera.Edit 9/24:So I have taken the time to click half way, let the camera focus, and then snap pictures. However, it still hesitates and occasionally decides it doesn't want to capture a picture. I went out last night and 50% of the pictures were blurred and fuzzy. It took awful group pictures. Imagine waiting and smiling and after 5 seconds (that's a long time when people are drinking) the camera doesn't even take a picture or after the wait, the camera decides to focus on dust floating by. It's not a good feeling when people think your NEW camera is broken. I feel like I wasted my money. Even my cheap Samsung TL105 could at least take pictures in a dark club. Don't get this camera unless you plan to take pictures in good lighting. Also, the video sucks on this camera.Edit 1/11/12:I bought the Canon ELPH 300 a few months ago and in comparison, when the Cyber-Shot does take a nice picture, it is sharp and beautiful. The Canon consistently takes nice, but soft pictures.

Reviews.Title: actual ower - nifty little snapshot camera
Reviews.Author: Davey Williams "davey williams"
Reviews.Content: I was able to get this model a little early, and was excited to try it out in - what better city to test a camera? - Paris. The last Sony snapshot camera I used was on a trip in 2007, and I was so dissatisfied with that camera that I sold it immediately after returning home. I was eager to see if Sony had improved their entry level cameras, especially the picture quality. I shall post some pictures to offer examples up in the product details, but these will be reduced in size for posting.Photo quality: My initial day out indicated that they have made dramatic improvements in both quality and speed. Photos in daylight were crisp and clear in just about every shot, and any that weren't were only because I was shooting poorly on purpose to test the photos. I was also quite happy with the quality of shots in low light and indoors, which is where I noticed the most improvement over past Sony low-end offerings. There was some blurring in darker situations, of course, but for the most part the software was able to produce images that are well balanced and low grain. The 14 megapixel feature is great - there are many photos I've been able to crop and retain quality, and photos of, say, a stone sarcophagus can be zoomed in upon when viewing images later to see very good detail.I must also mention that the camera is very good at balancing photos. It almost always produces a picture with an appropriate contrast, and only in the worst cases did the image wash out in an area. For example, a shot of Joan of Arc (the statue, not the person) in Notre Dame came out very well even with a stained glass window in the background. The stained glass was bright but distinguishable, and the detail of the stone statue was clear and well balanced. Only in extreme cases - such as a shot of a black sculpture in the Louvre with a window behind it with blaring sunlight - did the camera fail to balance the image, but these are the kind of bad photography shots one would never expect a camera to take well.Types of Photos: Like most all snapshot photos, this camera will perform best shooting still subjects with plenty of light. Moving objects didn't tend to blur, a problem I'd had with other cheap snapshot cameras, but the response time can make getting these shots difficult. Trying to capture a motorcycle passing an old church, my 7-10 attempts were mostly good photos, but getting the moving bike in the exact spot I wanted was nearly impossible.Features: Overall, this camera lacks in features, although for most uses I found it sufficient, and at the price I didn't expect a lot of extras. The 4x zoom is relatively fast and easy to use, and about right for this type of camera. I was surprised there was no optical zoom given the high megapixels, but I can live with cropping on the computer. The panorama mode is nifty but not that useful - it works quite well in creating a long image, which of course will cause distortion in most cases. To use this feature, you set the mode and clich the shutter. The camera will prompt you to move it from left to right, and then it will generate the image (which is always impossible to see on the display owing to its shape.) Here I would have liked some add'l features - there is just 'one size' for panorama shots - you must sweep all the way across or the image will fail. This creates many shots that will need to be messed with on the computer later, which is okay but annoying. I was also disappointed panorama doesn't work in an up and down orientation - you always have to sweep the camera in the same manner. You can, of course, hold it sideways to create a vertical panorama, but I really wanted some vertical shots tqking advantage of a larger width. Still, panoramas of the Tour Eiffel allowed me to create some fun, unique shots of the full height of the structure. There are not many other features - just some rudimentary quality settings, face detection, etc. Some might want to move up to a camera with more features, but I actually appreciated this in a point and shoot camera.Battery life: Here the camera could use some help. Perhaps I'm spoiled by my Apple products, but digital cameras have more or less remained stuck in 2002 concerning batteries. It's annoying to have a separate charger, and battery life isn't great. Three hours of shooting...granted, constant shooting...at St Denis drained it. Given how light and small it is, I'd fully support doubling the battery size to get twice the life. I'd also love for camera makers to start to move toward USB charging options.I'd also love it if cameras would start incorporating some onboard space. It feels like the dark ages to have to buy a card. 2 - 4 gig of onboard memory with a card slot for expansion would be nice.Overall, a great, small, fun camera that's easy to grab and go. I wish Sony would re-imagine some of the ways digital cameras work, perhaps taking some cues from iPods, especially regarding batteries, but for the price this nifty unit is great.Pros: Excellent pics for camera in this price range, good color balance, good in darker spaces, a few fun featuresCons: Battery life could be better, charging options, not many features or in-camera editing options

Reviews.Title: Excellent point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Me
Reviews.Content: This camera is a good item for you to carry to parties, trips and to take some casual pictures. Of course, you cant compare it with a professional digital camera.But, I must say that the quality of the pictures that it takes, is great. Now, it doesnt has lots of features, but that ones that it has are excellent.The face detection is very accurate. It detects faces quickly and the other features related to this one, are triggered very well.The smile detection is excelent, you can set it and it actually takes shots only if people smile. You can take your own pic with this feature, its pretty comfortable to take self-portraits with this, the same thing goes for the timer activated with the face detection.Something that I like a lot is that you can take pictures while moving or with the subject moving, and the picture will not get blury. And it also selects automatically the best scene to take the picture.In dark scenes, this camera performes very very well. You can take pictures with low light, and still get a very nice quality of picture.Now, one thing that is really nice, is that its very easy to use. These automatic features let you grab the camera and take shots without worrying about anything else.The battery life, at least for me, is pretty good. You can take lots of pics and record videos without worrying about yur battery life. Of course, dont expect to charge it only once a week. But you can be sure that it will last for the whole night or day or trip if you give it the proper charge.And well its very small and the color is very beatiful. It actually fits inside my pants pockets.Well, this camera is a good item to have. If you want a camera for having fun like me, take pictures in parties, trips or funny moments this is a really good choice.I hope this review helps you.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy this camera!
Reviews.Author: Jenna
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd Sony Cybershot camera (we really love the cameras).  It is super easy to use and takes great pictures.  However, we've had a lot of issues with the quality of the camera itself.  The first one just needed to be upgraded - so we got another Sony since we'd been so happy with it.  Second one I believe we got sand in at the beach - totally our fault.  The third one just randomly got a white screen last week.  First one half, then the other.  It's less than a year old and without a 10 month old receipt Sony is unwilling to do anything for us - other than offer us a minimum of $107 repair charge (which is more than the camera costs new).  The same exact thing happened to my mother-in-law so it's not a one off thing.  There is an issue and Sony's customer service was extremely disappointing.  Enough so that I decided to put my 2 cents worth out there.  :  Hope this helps someone else - we're shopping around for another brand and will likely never buy another Sony digital camera again.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Arielle E. Valenti "Ari Vee"
Reviews.Content: After owning and loving the 12.1 megapixel DSC-200 (earlier version of this model) I thought that surely the newer version would be even more fantastic. However, upon just holding it in my hands, I noticed that everything seemed more flimsy. True, it is a lighter, slightly more compact design, but the quality isn't as good as the old version. While watching video playback on my computer, I found that the resolution is really poor in comparison with that of the older one and the action shots are terrible, whereas I got tons of great ones with my old camera.Additionally, I have been using this camera for only a few months, and just two days ago I turned it on to find a white screen with what appears to be a horizontal crack running across its width; I guess it's a crack in the LCD screen. I am totally disgusted with the quality of the 530 - if the screen cracks while under very light, occasional use (my husband and I usually opt to use the camera on his Android over the Sony camera)then it is not practical for anyone.One good point: I did like the panorama feature while it lasted.

Reviews.Title: Simple and effective
Reviews.Author: Mike Ventura
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter for an upcoming trip.  She was able to use it before leaving and I got to see it up close.  This is a perfect camera for someone who just wants good images without too much fiddling with settings.  Face recognition technology, quality sensor and lens and ease of handling = very good photos.

Reviews.Title: Very very good results!!!
Reviews.Author: SAH
Reviews.Content: I have always been a fan of Sony cameras and this one is no exception. It is cheap and can make 1080p quality video (although keep in mind that it is not a video camera and you do not get much recording time while making videos). Pictures are crisp and I love the colors. The charger that comes with it has no cord, which means that it is  a direct wall mount charger and I like it. I think with a million cables around home already, I do not need more cables :)

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Lynn B
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera and have used it several times. It takes really nice pictures and the landscape portion does an awesome job. I took a picture of the lake we were at and it looked great. The only con I have is the zoom it is only 4x so you don't get much for zoom, but all in all it is a great little camera that will fit in a pocket or purse and is nice for taking close up pictures. I would recommend this camera to anyone wanting something small to carry and take instant pictures.Where I live I am on a township board and needed to take pictures of all the roads that needed repair, took great pictures, and printed them off, great clarity and crispness in the photos, could see all the details.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed in image quality
Reviews.Author: Consumer
Reviews.Content: I had tested it in the store because I was looking for a camera without so much lag time like our old one.  I was excited to get it because it's ready to go within a couple seconds after turning it on, the auto-focus is quick, and it's very quick in between shots.  We ordered the camera just before a trip to Disneyland where we took a lot of pictures but once I had a chance to review the pictures we had taken it was very disappointing.  The images all looked distorted almost like pictures from an old camera phone.  It also picked up a lot of glare from lights and there were light streaks through some of the pictures.  I'm glad I purchased on Amazon though because their return process is very simple.

Reviews.Title: Small enough.
Reviews.Author: Simon F. Rodehn
Reviews.Content: This camera is about as small as they ought to go with this level of pocket camera. All the features of the previous ones I have owned ( and that is quite a few). Worth the price and easily pocketed.

Reviews.Title: Perfect... With High Capacity SD Card
Reviews.Author: M. Rhymes
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for myself for everyday use instead of my bulky 10MP Lumix SLR and my 5MP Kodak Playsport still-shot option.First, I love the aesthetic of the design.  It's light, has an easy to use menu and excellent warm colors with high megapixel count.  Great for the money.  I did learn though that the QUALITY of your SD card determines how fast the digital camera processes per picture.  I started with my old SLR's 2MB basic SD card and upgraded to a $15 high capacity 4 MB SD card that processess 15MB p/second and it is noticably faster.  If I had went with the 20MB p/sec or 30MB p/sec card, I'm sure it'd be even zippier.  So happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: I. Hodge
Reviews.Content: Love the small look,light, small and conveinent for travelling. One thing I love about it is the 14.1mp also the shutter speed that allows u to take photos with out the blur from movements.Great price for this upgrade.However, purhcase the memory card at time of purchase as well.

Reviews.Title: I HATE THIS CAMERA!!
Reviews.Author: Bryan Hedrick
Reviews.Content: I love cameras, and I love taking pictures of my two little girls.  I write a blog, and take lots and lots  of pictures of my kids.  I pose them some time, but most of the time it's just hanging out looking cute, so I take a pic.I can take 70 pictures with this and get maybe 10 good ones. And I have missed so many sweet family shots because I only had one shot to take- not 70.  I have tried it on every one of the cutesy little settings, and they all blur terribly. You push the button, and one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, seconds FLASH, then it takes the picture.  Whatever cute thing the 1 year old was doing is missed. What ever happened to the "action" selection?The video is just as horrible.  It goes in and out of focus constantly and make a loud clicking noise on your video as it tries to focus.  I like to just sit the camera up on the tripod and get video of me and girls playing- not anymore. The entire videos are blurry.  Tried tech support several time.  They had me restart the camera.  They think I'm moving my hand too much.  Funny...I've been able to work cameras up until this one...Christmas, Easter, first birthday, third birthday- all videos that are in and out of focus like a drunkard coming to.I went with a more expensive camera thinking I'd get higher quality.  Don't do it!

Reviews.Title: Very disappointing, poor quality, hard to use
Reviews.Author: K-Lab
Reviews.Content: We bought this as a replacement camera for our teenage daughter, who likes to take photos of her friends and younger sisters.  Another daughter has the Sony Cybershot DSC-750 and it has been a great camera for a 10 year old and our whole family to use, so we bought this one thinking it would be similar with maybe a slight improvement in megapixels etc.  Not the case.  The camera feels cheap, the display is terrible, and the controls are confusing and very un-intuitive.  The camera manual is useless.  We have had many small point and shoot digital cameras and never had problems like we've had with this one.  The features sound great but we cannot make them work.  Over half the shots come out poorly, no matter how we attempt to adjust the settings.  Our main problems have been with focus and flash over-exposure.  We'll be returning this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice Cyber Shot
Reviews.Author: Luis Fernando dos Santos
Reviews.Content: Wonderful and pratical digital Camera that is easy to use. Even my daughter is able to use it. We have I big one, but this is easier to manage.

Reviews.Title: Priced better than Walmart.
Reviews.Author: Mike Phillips
Reviews.Content: Overall this is the third Cyber-shot I've had so far.Quite a smart camera with nice features to go with perfect snapshots.Though its not a Nikon or Leica, for simple snapshots, you can't find better.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: capturing
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product on vacation to replace a fantastic little Panasonic Lumix that took magnificent photos, however, a water accident finished it.  This was the first time I had used Sony digital cameras and after just 4 days the LCD screen distorted with a 2cm strip down left side white since then, and for one week all colour from the screen disappeared.  Slow to focus, and doesnt seem to know what the focus is on.  Agree 100% with previous reviewers, many photos turn out blurred, this rarely happened with the Panasonic.  Also, the battery cavity door slides open, its positioned under the camera where your thumb rests when taking shots, as move your thumb it opens the cover.  Overall,  a bit disappointed with the product, especially the indecisive slow focus.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as its predecessors
Reviews.Author: Malaya
Reviews.Content: Sometimes SONY name is enough for the quality. And for those who have used DSC camera is in the beginning would look no other. But this one seems to have gone retrogressive evolution, basing on the general trend. Outside its megapixel has increased to 14 which actually does not matter, (5 is enough for regular view, including post card prints). But many good features are missing.Its 'i' intelligent mode has replaced most of the modes. Sometimes it just doesnt work. example- if you are using the timer, with flash off, it does not adjust the focus, and captures irritatingly blurred picture, even when camera is kept static on table. Extra strong flash gives overt lighting. Large screen is good but combined they dry up the battery really fast. With preference mode-selectors gone it only luck that you get good pictures when background and object are in naturally good lighting condition.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera For Every Day Photos
Reviews.Author: Boredom010
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for walks through the park and whatnot, but if you're expecting the best, go spend your money on something more expensive. I like how there are different setting options for water, food, and other types of pictures. The quality of the photo already taken when zoomed in holds up fairly good. My only major complaint is the battery life doesn't last too long. Maybe for an hour, with continuous use. Overall, I think this is a great camera, and I would recommend it to anyone considering one for casual use!

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: RACERX
Reviews.Content: Obviously the lack of features is tied to the price.For the price this is an excellent value in every way.

Reviews.Title: Better then my Nikon
Reviews.Author: J. Bradford "JB"
Reviews.Content: I loved by past Coolpix Nikon, but was always annoyed with the lag of taking the photo. This time around I was searching for a quicker snap and this camera was the ticket. Takes the same great quality photos at a faster rate. I bought this one for my Mother, but now I am jealous and will be buying one for myself very soon!

Reviews.Title: just love it!
Reviews.Author: wesley
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my sister and she loved it, the color is beautiful, pictures are great, and she take it every where she goes.

Reviews.Title: Takes good pictures
Reviews.Author: V
Reviews.Content: Actually, this camera takes fabulous pictures. If you can point and shoot without shaking excessively, this is the camera for you. The picture quality comes out amazing, and the auto-detecting features of the camera are very helpful as well. Things might show up a little grainy on the LCD screen in less-than-optimal lighting but once you get it onto the computer that's where you see just how great the picture quality of this camera is. I was taking pictures with my cousin the other day and he even compared it to SLR quality pictures!Some may think that 14.1 MP is a little excessive - it is. Correct me if I'm wrong, because I heard this from a friend, but theoretically the human eye can only see the difference up to 12 MP for regular sized photos. Higher MP also takes up more space on your memory card, so if you're the type of person who never deletes pictures make sure to get a bigger SDHC card. I personally prefer the best quality pictures, whether or not my eyes can detect the difference, so I went for the highest MP on the market.It is a lot smaller than I imagined it to be. It's totally pocket-sized and very easy to carry around.Unfortunately, aside from fantastic pictures, cool features, and the cute size, this camera is lacking everywhere else. When I first picked it up I was surprised at the cheap quality of the plastic that covered it. Of course, this makes it very light and also adds to the portability of this little camera. But I'm also very afraid of dropping this thing because I'd expect it to break into pieces in its first fall. If you know you are prone to dropping things, this might not be the camera for you. Of course, this problem can be fixed by using the wrist strap provided in the packaging, and/or spending an additional $5-$10 on a camera case. But I still have to reiterate that this camera's exterior is really not made very well. The door for the AV cord (the cord that connects the camera to the computer via USB) wiggles like a loose tooth and I wouldn't be surprised if it broke off altogether within the next year. I wouldn't recommend this camera for children under 13.I agree with the other reviewers that the shutter speed for this camera is indeed, horrifyingly slow. I don't think this is the type of cameras to take to sports games or other places where there is a lot of movement and fidgeting involved. This may be the first camera I can call my own, but I know for a fact that compared to other cameras, this one very nearly crosses the line for being unreasonably slow. For my own purposes though, as a female college student who's not very interested in sports and doesn't have kids running around, I can look past this slight negative aspect.I haven't had the chance to use this camera all that much for an event or anything. So far I've only used it to test the quality of pictures, so as of now I can't really say anything about the battery life. But I don't think its that bad, really. Battery life is always something that everything can improve on.Overall, for the price of only a little over $100, you have to admit: this camera takes wonderful pictures. And I think the outstanding quality of photos this camera produces makes up for all its flaws. I am very happy about this purchase, but honestly, if something were to happen to this camera and I needed to replace it, I would go for a different model.

Reviews.Title: Not too impressed
Reviews.Author: Sunset
Reviews.Content: Display is blurry and goes in and out of blurriness and focus constantly. When you first snap a picture the preview is much more blurry than when you go back and look at it. Pictures are all too grainy. Some shots turn out great.  Doesn't have many features.  Wide angle lens distorts the edges of pictures too much.Camera looks great but that's about it. I am not particularly impressed.  Nikon s3000 was a better camera but I bumped it too hard and the lens stopped retracting.

Reviews.Title: Great small camera!
Reviews.Author: R. Marcus "Fast Frog"
Reviews.Content: This product was surprisingly small! Even though I've got small hands, I'm older and and hanging on to things becomes more of a challange as time goes by. The pic quality is superb! And you have more "how to take" options than you can shake a stick at, but they work. The computer interfacing was a little frightning but as a non techno-geek I just followed directions and things fell into place. I like the picture enhancing tools which R easy to use as you review your down loaded pics. There's a ton of tech applications that one can use if you're into high tech viewing. The battery life could be better. This is the one draw back that that needs to be noted. However, for less than $130 this 14.1 megapixel camera, 4 gig card and nice carry case is a great buy!!

Reviews.Title: Picture quality
Reviews.Author: Tina Toskin
Reviews.Content: I found the camera very easy to use and took great pictures.  It is very easy to take viedos.  The camera gives the user a lot of flexibility. Especially liked the stabilzaion

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Juliet
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a bit over a year now and I really have been happy with the purchase.  It's lightweight and slim, which makes it easy to carry. It's small enough that I can easily carry it in my pocket if I don't want to be weighed down with a bag while exploring.The picture quality is also quite nice. I travel a decent amount and tend to take a lot of photos when I do, and I always get compliments on the quality of the photos that I have taken with this camera.  The lines are sharp and the color quality is always good and true to life.  The camera has multiple settings, but I tend to leave it on the "intelligent auto" setting and the photos always come out good.I have recommended this camera to several people looking to purchase a new one.

Reviews.Title: Blurry Pics
Reviews.Author: klogr
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews.  This camera is horrible! I had another Sony cyber-shot and loved it, and although a few other people complained of blurry pics, many people seemed to love this camera so I gave it a shot. At first I did love it, took great pictures. After 2 months of use my husband and I can't get it to work. Of course this is a couple weeks before we are about to have our baby, and right before Christmas so we can't take descent pics of our 5 yr old on Christmas or of our new baby!! What is even more infuriating is that it stopped working right after Amazon would replace it. Now they say I can return it for 50% of what I paid!!! Unbelievable. This is NOT a good purchase.

Reviews.Title: Expected MUCH more from this camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: When I bought this camera, I read reviews and researched quite a bit before buying.  I should have listened to the people who said this camera was not all that great!  For all the hype that the description gives, it's really not all that great.  I was replacing a Canon point and shoot that had an aperture malfunction and I guess once you go Canon, you never go back!  This one just doesn't live up to my Canon.  I was expecting a nice solid camera but this one is made of plastic.  My Canon Elph, solid metal and super durable.  Here's my list of Pros and Cons.Pros:LightSmallWide angle lens (Nice to have)Large displayCons:Plastic casingButtons are too small, have to use fingernail to push most of themFocusing issues ALL OF THE TIMELack of picture taking scene modesNo flash means a blurry picture almost every time unless you are using a tripodUp close pics of small things are difficult to focus onFeels very cheapI'm certain that if I drop this camera......it will be done!Update 12/28/2012I put this camera aside and gave it to my 10 yr old as a Christmas gift.  She loves it but she doesn't really need anything fancy right now anyway.  This camera leaves MUCH to be desired.  I went back to my love, Canon.  Canon HS40 SX!!  LOVE LOVE LOVE it!!

Reviews.Title: Blurry Pictures
Reviews.Author: Boston Rachel
Reviews.Content: I bought this Sony camera in November 2011 from Amazon after I lost my Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera. I've always stayed loyal to Canon but after spending a lot of money on a camera and losing it, I decided to buy a cheaper point and shoot. That was a mistake.The camera has good features: smile detection, face detection and panoramic pictures. The quality of the pictures comes out only 20% of the time. On a recent trip, I asked someone to use the camera and she asked "How do I make the pictures less blurry?". Simply, you do not. You have to guess when the camera will react as one would suggest. All my pictures are blurry and the quality is not there - even when shooting on "anti-blur" mode. I would not buy this product again nor recommend it to a friend. Stick with Canon or Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Big bang for little $$$
Reviews.Author: KM "KM"
Reviews.Content: I got this about 6 months ago, and am DELIGHTED with it. It takes good pics with a snap of the button, and not fooling around with settings all the time. Easy, Peasy!Pros:*  It's Small! Yay! Won't pull your shoulder off if you put it in  your purse.*  It's SOOOOO Easy to use. Seriously, I hate fooling with settings, and this is point & click. Period.*  Big view screen, so you can see without squinting. Clear, too. No glasses needed - Yay!.*  Huge megapixels, means you can crop oversize shots without pixelating the pic.*  Good battery life - so far. I don't take a lot of pics, but only needed to charge it a couple times.*  User friendly menu. No need to bring a book with you to figure out what all the symbols mean.***  GREAT Features:+  Has an optional grid, so you keep level.+  Has optional face detection, and smile detection, so it won't take the pic til someone smiles.+  Has optional center focal point, so if you want a bug pic, it will focus on the bug, not the flowers.+  Takes Panoramic pics with one click (& hold). No need to stitch pics together, just press the button, and spin around slowly. I did it freehand  from my chair just to test, and even with wildly different lighting and windows, it came out seamlessly, and nearly perfect. And I have shakey hands!My hubby and sons spend ridiculous money on fancy, manual adjusting cameras, and I couldn't use them. I just wanted to have a quick and easy point & click. THIS is IT. I've had others in the past, but this is the best I've ever owned. GREAT camera, and Great results.  Super easy to use, and lots of helpful features.Cons:  None so far. I love this one.

Reviews.Title: I love my little pink camera!
Reviews.Author: frequentamazonshopper
Reviews.Content: This camera takes quality photos. I usually take the photos in extra large format and then I shrink them once I download them to my computer. This baby picks up every detail. Great quality photos and the camera automatically adjusts to the lighting! The flash is amazing. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Smile for the Camera
Reviews.Author: Bernie Kimpal
Reviews.Content: I am  impressedn every time I order from Amazon. The new Sony Cyber-Shot camera is just great! I did my homework and chose this Sony and got a great price. This camera has a Carj Zies Vario-Tessar zoom lens that is super sharp. There are many choices that are high quality,but this Sony Camera is just what I was looking for. Thanks to Amazon,once again

Reviews.Title: Decent Camera
Reviews.Author: opeysmama
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift after my Cannon A2000IS died. It is very small, which is nice unless you have large hands or arthritic hands. It takes nice photos in general, and the advanced features make switching between modes amazing, although it takes getting use to. I am not impressed with the indoor photos that need flash, however. I do not like the heavy yellow tone the flash seems to leave. The flash also leaves the subject overexposed. One will need to practice before understanding how to get the best flash photos. This is the exact complaint I had with my first Sony, and why I switched over to a Cannon. I have yet to locate and flash adjustment to tone it down. Overall, nice little camera for everday use.

Reviews.Title: It's an entry level Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Sergio
Reviews.Content: I returned this item because in did not like the quality of the pics. It's an entry level digital camera, and i got what i paid for. But if you understand just a little bit of photography, i recomend you to run away from this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for Quick Pics
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I like the camera a whole lot, i spent the weekend in Frankfurt and it took very good  quality pictures for it's price. It's not great for catching scenery but for things like buildings its perfect. The battery lasted me all four days of my weekend and I was constantly turning it back on and off, it only takes a second for it to turn on and be ready to take a picture.PROS:Great Camera for quick picturesGood Quality Pictures and VideoVery bright flash, easy to turn off and onSoftware it comes with is very organizationalCONS:4x Zoom isn't very muchNot very good for Wide Scenery picturesDidn't come with an SD card (They are cheap enough though I bought a 8gb, takes about 1200 pictures)I'm happy I purchased the Camera.

Reviews.Title: I DID NOT THINK IT WAS POSSIBLE.....
Reviews.Author: C.C. LESTERS
Reviews.Content: HOW CAN SOMETHING NOT ZOOM IN AND OUT DURING A VIDEO????BESIDES THAT CAMERA IS FINE....BUT GOODNESS GRACIOUS!!!  NO ZOOM!!!!KILLIN ME SMALLS....

Reviews.Title: Características técnicas vr's Precio
Reviews.Author: Giovanni
Reviews.Content: La cámara cuenta con suficientes características técnicas (Marca, Zoom Optico, Tamaño de la pantalla LCD, Capacidad de almacenamiento, batería recargable, funciones, software, tamaño y peso) por un buen precio.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with this camera!
Reviews.Author: Brendan111
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price.  I was looking for a camera for party or casual pictures and I have always used Sony for such purposes.  This camera is ready to use and offers plenty of features and functions for me to take great pictures.  The pictures taken with sufficient light, as always, are crisp and clear.  What I really noticed is how clear the pictures turn out even if they are shot indoors or with very very low light (this is a big difference compared to other Sony cameras a few years old).  One feature that I like a lot is that you can take pictures while either you or the subject is moving, and the picture will not get blury.  The camera automatically selects the best shot.  I am very pleased with this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great first time camera
Reviews.Author: Stacey Booms
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my 10 year old.  It has been easy to use, takes nice pictures! Love the fun colors.

Reviews.Title: very good camera for teenagers
Reviews.Author: leja
Reviews.Content: my daughter, 18 years old asked for a low price camera, and I was surprised when I saw very clear shots done at night. I think that I have not achieved that bright images with more expensive cameras, so I am surprised with this perfomance and very pleased at all

Reviews.Title: love the color
Reviews.Author: druesmom95
Reviews.Content: I have taken quite a few pictures with my new camera.  So far, I like it alot.  It is easy to use & the pictures seem to be good quality.  I am so glad I held out for the green, I absolutely LOVE the color.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality, even for the price
Reviews.Author: Anne-Marie
Reviews.Content: Beware - this camera does NOT have a macro feature. It has been replaced (compared to older model Sony Cyber Shots) with a smile detection feature (who even needs that?). The test shots I did were poor quality, even with the camera automatically detecting and choosing settings. The camera is very small, so rather than turning a dial to the feature you want, you have to flip through digital menus. Overall, this camera was not at all what I expected - in features or quality - and was returned right away.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: naturalshark
Reviews.Content: This camera is portable and the picture quality is excellent. The price is reasonable and I simply love this camera. It comes with rechargeable battery and charger

Reviews.Title: Light-weight super camera
Reviews.Author: MomOf3
Reviews.Content: Very light weight camera so, for those heavy handed individuals  -  this is not the camera for you.  I bought this camera because I needed a newer camera & wanted to take my family Christmas pictures.  Pictures were quick to focus in on 3 active young children and could quickly re-shoot if needed.  Clear crisp pictures for both short and long-range.  I noticed a lot of individuals had issues with battery life length (or lack there-of).  I actually haven't had to recharge it yet since Saturday (it is now Tuesday) and I have been turning it on & off, doing pictures here and there every day to include the 84 Christmas pictures I took on Saturday.  Still good to go.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot for the money
Reviews.Author: OfficerT
Reviews.Content: The camera is very nice, great resolution even at magnified zooms. The only aspect preventing this from a 5 star is the fact the battery life is not-so great. It might be a Sony thing because my Viao is not great on battery either. Nice face detection and nice overall camera. Worth the buy.

Reviews.Title: best camera for 100 bucks!
Reviews.Author: Friend of God forever
Reviews.Content: Amazed that this camera was only 100 bucks - awesome panorama, awesome face selection and close-ups - wow! would buy again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use, Good Pictures, Good Value
Reviews.Author: MWB
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera before a vacation, and was very impressed with the results.  I'm far from an expert in photography, and I was basically looking for an inexpensive camera that took nice pictures.  This fit the bill.  Small, light, easy to use, and nice quality photos.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Christinex91
Reviews.Content: This camera is FANTASTIC if your getting it for yourself or someone who is interested in digital photography but isn't ready to leap into getting a DSLR camera. It shoots fantastic photos every single color is picked up and looks great when you view them on your computer screen and go to print them. I defiantly recommend this camera and getting a 4gb memory card. You'll love taking photos with this camera a 1gb or 2gb memory card wont work unless you want to keep buying them that is. Over all great camera make sure you have it on steady mode in case you tend to shake a bit while taking photos. It also takes great photo's if your inside a moving car and want to snap a  photo of something. The smile detection and face detection are awesome and so is the macro setting. Its a bit annoying when your close to something and have to wait for the camera to recognize it if you have it on auto-mode other then that go buy it and have fun shooting pictures :).

Reviews.Title: Owner Review - Nice Point & Shoot
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera on sale to replace a point & shoot I had purchased in early '08.  My previous camera had HD video capture and a little more optical zoom, but it also cost about $70 more, even on sale.  This camera has two more megapixels, much better image stabilization, intelligent auto, and color accuracy.  I've been very happy with its overall performance; the only thing that hasn't impressed me is the battery life, but sometimes it can take a few charges for batteries to reach a true peak.  In response to the person who complained about the icons when trying to access your photos from the computer: the icons this camera uses on the screen are stored as files in the camera, and for some reason I guess most computers want to open that folder by default (I ran into this as well.)  There is probably a way to change the default folder your computer goes to when you hook up your cable, or if you have a memory card, you can remove it and place it directly in your computer to access your images.  The mild annoyance of my computer not knowing where to retrieve my images did not change the fact that this camera takes far superior pictures to my old camera at a fraction of the cost and in a much more portable package.  I'm very impressed.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Heather L. Suhor
Reviews.Content: I have always bought Sony cameras because i just love them. They are a great point and shoot camera. This camera takes great pictures, is compact, and lightweight.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Decent Little Camera EXCEPT...
Reviews.Author: ILoveLivingRural
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the folks that have said that this camera has a metal BODY. It has a metal FRONT and everything else is plastic.The camera is nice but the all plastic bottom is too loose and opens too easily and should be addressed. In fact, it's a defect to where I should return the camera but I won't because it's not worth sending the whole camera back.All in all, it's a nice camera, takes decent pictures but the build quality leaves a lot to be desired!

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: this camera is a great lettle camera and it has good features and takes high quality picturs. i would defenetly recamend this camera to a friend. it's also great that it comes with many different colors.  the one downside is that it doesn't come with a memory card.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: M. Rojas
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the quality for the price! I have another camera that I paid the same amount of money for and it doesn't compare. The quality is crisp and clear! The camera is light and easy to carry around.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: kcaracci
Reviews.Content: This camera is great! The color drew me to the final point of purchasing it after I read all the specs and reviews. The panoramic feature is a must for those of you who like to take those types of pics. Great zoom feature, and a good battery life. And for the price... great camera!

Reviews.Title: GREAT LITTLE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Peter Soundias
Reviews.Content: i have not have this camera too long , but  it takes great pictures, its small and it is easy to operate. I LOVE IT.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: US.ARMY RET "xcavmedic"
Reviews.Content: Bought for my daughter and she is very happy with it! She owned the previous model and found this model just as easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Not designed well
Reviews.Author: Brian M.
Reviews.Content: I actually bought this camera, then returned for a second because I thought it was defective.  The battery door on these cameras is made very poorly to the point that when you pull the camera out of a pouch, the door opens.  This may or may not be a big deal for some people, but I know with enough wear and tear, the door is going to break off.

Reviews.Title: That is the fastest service I have received at my APO Address. Thank you
Reviews.Author: cmeda80
Reviews.Content: This a very fine camera. It is worth every penny I pad for it. Great Quality for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Glur
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to be an upgrade over smartphone cameras and it hasn't disappointed. I have not used the panorama or video modes but for straight photos this camera works very well, power on time is quick, picture quality is quite good even with zoom and the included software works well.

Reviews.Title: Quick correction to Davey Williams' review
Reviews.Author: Anisa
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera and I love it! Perfect quick-shot camera with lots of different options and settings. I really appreciated Davey Williams' comments, but there is an incorrect statement about the panorama sweep setting (which is so cool, by the way!). There actually are additional settings besides the "left to right" sweep. If you click the "menu" button when you are in the panorama sweep mode, it gives you four options for shooting directions (left to right, right to left, bottom to top, and top to bottom), as well as options for standard or wide panorama size and more. It's great! Overall, I really like this camera :)

Reviews.Title: Great for it's size!
Reviews.Author: Tina
Reviews.Content: This little guy is a great point and shoot for traveling -- it slips into almost any pocket and starts up quick to get a shot fast. The battery life leaves something to be desired and I really can't wait for the day that every camera can charge by USB.Note: if you are traveling with this camera, make sure you by a converter that does not have raised edges -- one of mine does and the charger plug cannot fit in between the edges.Overall, I'm glad I bought this. It's the right price, works pretty well, and has a great panorama feature. Amazon also has great deals on cases and SD cards, so bundle if you need those!

Reviews.Title: Too slow to take pictures of Kids
Reviews.Author: Nils Henninger
Reviews.Content: This camera takes good still images. However, if you plan on taking pictures of your kids--they better not move. This camera is just way too slow take any reasonable shots. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera - BEST PICE!!
Reviews.Author: P. Ganapa
Reviews.Content: Camera has good features  very easy to use, light weight. To get good quality pictures one has to take pictures in 2 steps1 step  - press an hold the click button until auto focus ( green color box appears on the camera screen)2 step  -  let go the click button and give 1/2 - 1 sec and then take the picture.By doing this even night shots and other picture will have good clarity. the same is mention in user's manual of the camera.

Reviews.Title: A good choice
Reviews.Author: Akula
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera for a 2 week family vacation. After weeks of reading camera reviews and comparing prices (that will drive you crazy due to the vast number of cameras available) I settled on this one as having more than enough features for the average user.It worked fine. I do agree with the comments I have seen in other reviews about the battery door being very flimsy. It can be broken easily.I would recommend buying the trim to fit plastic sheets to protect the viewing screen as car keys or loose change in your pocket can scratch the screen.

Reviews.Title: Sony rocks....
Reviews.Author: itzMe_Prasad
Reviews.Content: Best for home photography...really good camera for beginners. i have CANON ELPH100HS which costlier than W530 but worst in performance when compared. So i think dont go on some technical jargon rather take a simpler one which fits to your requirement. Go for W530 simple camera with fewer options but better picture quality compared to others.

Reviews.Title: Not good for photographing children
Reviews.Author: MomtoTwoCincy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera hoping it'd be the perfect addition to my purse- the camera I could use it to catch shots of my children at the park, birthday parties, etc.  But the only pro to this camera is that it is easy to use.  It's super slow and hard to focus.  There were so many pictures that I missed because it took too long to take the picture (and, as you know, kids don't quite sit still).  I have shots of them getting up, turning their heads, with their eyes closed, but very few shots that I actually wanted!  And, many of them are blurry because the kids moved.  There were also times that I missed the opportunity altogether because I had to press the button multiple times or hold it down.  It's really a plug-and-play item in that once I charged the battery I could just toss it in my purse and go.  But, I had to return it, I didn't want to take the chance of missing all the holiday fun.  I'm currently looking for a quicker, sharper, and easy-to-use point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: EXCELENTE CAMARA
Reviews.Author: ANA TROMBETTA
Reviews.Content: ES UNA CAMARA PRECIOSA QUE LOGRA IMAGENES MUY NITIDAS,TIENE UN ZOOM BUENO,LA FUNCION PANORAMICA ES MUY UTIL, EL VIDEO TAMBIEN ES BUENO, SI NOTO QUE LA CAMARA CONSUME RAPIDO LA BATERIA, DE FORMA GENERAL MUY BUEN PRODUCTO EXCELENTE INVERSION DE DINERO.

Reviews.Title: Works well for a while
Reviews.Author: Rachel Nelson
Reviews.Content: I have gone through two versions of this camera and had the same problem both times.  I loved each camera at first, but then after about a year of use, the shutter starts to not work well, and won't always take a picture.  I thought it was a fluke with the first camera since I had used it so much, but now that it has happened with a second camera, I don't plan on purchasing a Sony camera again.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Susan D. Farr
Reviews.Content: Love this and have carried and used this camera all over the country.  So easy to use and charge.  Need to buy charger so east to do.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I Have Used!
Reviews.Author: Stephanie S.
Reviews.Content: This camera takes MUCH better quality pictures than any other camera I have had or used. The pictures look fantastic and don't come out blurry even when my son is running around being silly. The panoramic option is a wonderful feature to get super large pictures!

Reviews.Title: GOOD
Reviews.Author: Jorge Ramirez
Reviews.Content: Really Nice, Works perfectly. is what i was looking for in this product. Recommended 100 %, Easy to use. Excellent purchase.

Reviews.Title: Image stabilization is inferior to canon's
Reviews.Author: Sidney Crosby
Reviews.Content: The only that matters to me is if the shot is crisp. I got this camera for free and was excited because my old Canon powershot was, old. I took this out one night and it was so difficult to get a crisp and unblurry image. I get that whenever you take images in low light, the quality of the image isn't going to be as good. But, I never had this problem with my Canon.Therefore, I must conclude that Sony's image stabilization on this camera is not very good.

Reviews.Title: Handy travel cam.
Reviews.Author: vega paul
Reviews.Content: I always bring a camera everywhere I go and this is a very  convenient unit. Very useful for snap shots. Just don't  compare it to d slr quality. Takes quite sometime to familiarize with the functions. Tho, auto settings will deliver good shots with its carlzeis lens specially outdoor shots.

Reviews.Title: poor battery life
Reviews.Author: Ray
Reviews.Content: great pictures, easy to use but battery life is terrible. Another issue is that both the memory card and the battery are behind the same little door and that means it will not last long. Battery is confusing to install and could easily be forced in backwards.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: alejandro72ve
Reviews.Content: The camera is fabulous option panoramic photography is amazing, very good and the price is excellent. Light and the menu is very intuitive.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera that's easy to use
Reviews.Author: Mr. Thomas E. Gackle "Mr. Helpful"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera that fits easily in your pocket and starts up quickly.  Not great for fast action shots but if you are just taking still photos, it's perfect.  It's certainly a very durable, easy to handle and quick to use camera that's a bargain for the money.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Autumn L. Harwood "jpdharwood"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, I would never buy another brand but SONY, I just love their products especially cameras, just excellent product and price for this. :) Extremely happy customer :)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: La Belle (The Beauty)
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a gift and I haven't had any problems with it. It has a zoom in and zoom out feature, 3 different ways to shoot, (which includes taking a still shot, a panoramic shot, or shoot a video) a delete button, a menu button, (which I've never used) a play button, and a button where you could turn the flash on or off.For the most part, I enjoy this camera. The only thing I didn't like about it is that you can't shoot pictures in Black & White. With my old digital camera, there is a feature where you could choose to shoot your photos in black and white, but with this one, you can't. I know that a lot of photos look better in color, but there are some photos that look better in Black & White.Some reviewers have complained that they've had problems with this camera. I've had it for almost 3 years and haven't had one single problem with it. If I ever get a chance, I will upgrade to a newer one because every few years they make newer, better models. I probably won't upgrade for a while though. I think I'll keep this camera for at least a few more years. I'll have to try different brands to see which one I like the best. Sony's were the only ones I've ever had, but I'll have to try them out and see if there's one that I like better than a Sony.

Reviews.Title: Had one before
Reviews.Author: Mz. Medusa
Reviews.Content: This is my second time buying this.  The first one got damaged on vacation and I loved this so much, I bought a second.  Super easy to use.

Reviews.Title: It'll do
Reviews.Author: Angelita Gomez
Reviews.Content: I was pretty upset that I paid for expedited shipping and it didn't arrive to me in time, but other than that, but other than that the camera was in working condition. A bit more scratched than I'd hoped.

Reviews.Title: Sony the best !
Reviews.Author: felixdahousecat
Reviews.Content: Sony is Sony......Nothing to declare... Simple... Sony is the best one !!!!Congratulations japanese guys !!!You guys know !!

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Vicky Marier
Reviews.Content: Awesome delivery time and product.  I would recommend this product to family members. This product was recommended in a magazine and it is one of the best camera out there.

Reviews.Title: Durable camera
Reviews.Author: Jeanne
Reviews.Content: I use this camera for work, taking an average of 100 photos per day.  The camera is easy to use & very durable.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Michael B. Labelle "thetaz1"
Reviews.Content: I received this as a Christmas gift last year and absolutely love the camera. It is small, yet takes very good pictures, high quality and very good detail.I use it mainly for Project and estimating pictures, rugged and tough. I cannot say enough about this camera.If you need a quality camera, with decent zoom capabilities, quality/detailed pictures for a reasonable price then look no further.

Reviews.Title: Not the best, not the worst.
Reviews.Author: opeysmama
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera out of desperation because I broke my Cannon. This camera is small and lightweight, easy to use, and pretty basic. The two things I dislike about this camera are 1) some of my images are distorted, very unnatural warp of the edges of the photos and 2) the flash is horrid. I have had Sony models before and the same exact sorry flash hasn't changed a bit. However, outside shots turn out fine, as long as you don't zoom too much or try to catch action shots. I'll be giving this to my kids to use because I'm buying myself a Cannon.

Reviews.Title: great deal.
Reviews.Author: angelintouch
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 70 year old mom. She doesn't really know how to use new technology so buying this camera for her was a big deal. But she is learning how to use it because the camera is not difficult to use. It a simple point and shoot with very easy access to print the images from any drugstore and also to check and delete images right from the big screen. The battery pack has arrows on the battery as well as the charger unit so you can't put it in wrong.Great camera and simple for anyone to use.

Reviews.Title: Very poor image quality
Reviews.Author: Cando_kid
Reviews.Content: The image was very blurry even when the best image quality settings were applied. This was a complete waste of money. Returned item immediately.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Dan I Rovner
Reviews.Content: Nice, easy camera to operate.  My daughter loves it and she takes it with her everywhere.  Its easy to transfer pictures to her computer and facebook.

Reviews.Title: SONY FAVORITE
Reviews.Author: Judy L Otis
Reviews.Content: I can't say I love my new camera yet because I'm still getting used to it..so far so good.  The size is perfect and the pictures are a good quality.  I love sony products so I expect that with more use and experience I will love this.

Reviews.Title: good for a 1st camera.
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: It is a great camera and takes great pictures but at times forever to take a picture when you want to take a candid shot.

Reviews.Title: It's ok.
Reviews.Author: Agnes Do
Reviews.Content: I like it, but it's missing the USB cable to upload the photos to my PC. Otherwise, It is fine.

Reviews.Title: Refurb but perfect
Reviews.Author: Niccol Valentine
Reviews.Content: The camera is amazing, light and easy to carry/pack. I enjoy the rechargeable battery and all the options. This is a better camera than the one I paid for previously.

Reviews.Title: My husband's present
Reviews.Author: anniez
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband as we were going back to England and our first trip to Paris.  I thought he would really enjoy it.  Great gift at a great price

Reviews.Title: Sony
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: Very good camera, excellent product, the sharpness of your photos and the resolution is incredible. Easy to use and connect to the PC. thanks

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: bubs
Reviews.Content: I did a bit of research before picking which camera to buy but apparently not enough. Granted this is a very cheap camera but I was disappointed by how deformed the pictures are near the edges and how some of the colors are so saturated.

Reviews.Title: muy buen producto
Reviews.Author: Joseph Alvarez
Reviews.Content: era lo que buscaba muy buen producto excelente calidad la resolucion perfecta lo recomiendo 1oo por ciento envio llego a tiempo

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: VE149760 Oxmar Riera
Reviews.Content: muy buena calidad el profucto satisfecho al cien por ciento de la compra muy recomendado desde venezuela gracias gracias gracias

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: Muneesh Sharma "MS"
Reviews.Content: sony never goes wrong.. how n why this thing captures better crisp vivid colorful n overall amazing pics when compared side by side to the pics taken on auto mode of my canon sx20 is not understood by me... my wife will not let go of this device.. alwayz in her purse ready to snap beutiful shots..

Reviews.Title: Excelente camera
Reviews.Author: Cesar Patiño
Reviews.Content: Excelente camera. con todos los accesorios y manual . . . . . . . . . . . .

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyder Shot
Reviews.Author: jockett
Reviews.Content: This Was A Gift To My Daughter For Christmas & She Loved It..Also The Camera's Condition Was Great.....Very Satisfied With This Camera

Reviews.Title: Excellent!!
Reviews.Author: José Mendoza
Reviews.Content: High quality camera, hight quality pictures!! excelents configurations options to make your pictures better!! came with al its accesories i recommend!!

Reviews.Title: EXCELENTE COMPRA
Reviews.Author: FERNANDO
Reviews.Content: REALMENTE, DE MUCHA UTILIDAD, FACIL MANEJO Y SOBRE TODO ME SIRVE PARA RECORDAR MOMENTOS QUE TAL VEZ NO VOLVERAN, Y LA CALIDAD EXCELENTE.

Reviews.Title: good for the price
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo Segura
Reviews.Content: Good pictures, a good priceFully automatics, thats reduce the options if you want to take an special pictureworks fine and the battery have an aceptable performance

Reviews.Title: Bueno
Reviews.Author: Daniel Garcia
Reviews.Content: Excelente producto, cumple totalmente con el requerimiento, escelente entrega, buen negocio, muy agradecido.  Llego en buen estado y perfectas condiciones

Reviews.Title: Not what I needed
Reviews.Author: karen powell
Reviews.Content: Camera was ok for simple things. I needed a faster shutter speed. After you click it takes a few seconds to take the picks. Not good for moving objects. Gave to my granddaughter.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: A. Hawkins
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves this camera! Fits in her back pocket and takes great pictures! Would purchase again-and probably will for the other daughter

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: ezra
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera for the price and can suffer some abuse. After repeatedly dropping this thing on rocks, the screen finally broke (although the camera still worked fine). This is worth the money and I would recommend it, although I would also recommend getting a case.

Reviews.Title: Super
Reviews.Author: ggiorgi
Reviews.Content: - - - It's very good and it was as described. If you buy you will not regret!  - - -

Reviews.Title: Excelente!!!
Reviews.Author: Juan Carlos Castillo
Reviews.Content: Muy seguro, muy buena compra!!!Magnifico de muy buena calidad, muy bonito, estoy muy contento con la compra muchas Gracias!Excelente!!!Excelente!!!

Reviews.Title: camara
Reviews.Author: JORGE MORENO
